CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE criminal investigations were instituted against ORG suspects , including the applicant ( a businesswoman ) on suspicion of several counts of tax fraud , involving the issue of CARDINAL fictitious invoices . The applicant ’s company was concerned in each count of fraud . The material of the ensuing investigation amounted to CARDINAL pages .

CARDINAL . On DATE tax investigators searched the applicant ’s house for documents and arrested her . The applicant alleges that the tax investigators’ behaviour was harsh and insensitive in that they hindered her for TIME from providing her minor son with a spray - inhaler when he suffered an asthma attack during the search . Moreover , she submits that , on her arrest , she was forcibly seated in the authority ’s car , in which the tax investigators touched her inappropriately and made abusive remarks .
She was kept in police custody for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint about the tax investigators’ conduct . On DATE ORG refused to proceed with the complaint , considering that the investigators had carried out the search and the arrest in accordance with the law . The ORG noted that the applicant had complained about the incident only after a delay of DATE . On DATE and DATE and DATE , respectively , PERSON and ORG and the Attorney ORG dismissed the applicant ’s further complaints .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the police again searched the applicant ’s house .

In her submissions to the ORG filed on DATE , the applicant stated that on that occasion she had been ill - treated by the police officers and that the latter had not allowed the emergency medical staff , which had been called to her son on account of another asthma attack , to enter the house .
On DATE ORG discontinued the investigation into the incident . On DATE the ORG finally dismissed the applicant ’s complaint .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE and DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE , the applicant was interrogated by ORG .
